name: Rolls-Royce Enthusiasts Club
description: The Rolls-Royce Enthusiasts Club (RREC) is one of the largest clubs dedicated to the preservation and celebration of Rolls-Royce and Bentley motorcars.
fullDescription:
## About the RREC

The Rolls-Royce Enthusiasts Club (RREC) caters for anyone with an interest in the motor car products of Rolls-Royce Ltd and Bentley Motors Ltd. From the start of production in 1904 until the current Rolls-Royce and Bentley cars built by BMW and VW respectively.

The RREC was founded in 1957 and now has over 10,000 members worldwide. The club has sections throughout the UK as well as many overseas sections. Throughout the year the RREC organises a wide range of technical, social, and competitive motoring and social events for its members.

Members of the RREC receive the club magazine 'The Spirit' six times a year, which contains technical articles, members' cars, club news and events listings. The club also publishes high-quality books about the marques.
